usefulItems: serving bowls, baking tray (30 x 40 cm), aluminium foil, pastry brush, large bowl, thermal serving bowl or other large bowl, oven
title: Sticky sesame chicken

ingredients.content: 800 g boneless skinless chicken thighs, cut into pieces (3 cm - see Tips)
2 carrots (approx. 180 g), cut into thin slices (5 mm)
2 spring onions/shallots, trimmed and cut into thin slices, for garnishing

preparations.content: Preheat oven to 200°C. Line a baking tray (30 x 40 cm) with aluminium foil. Brush with oil and set aside.

Place a large bowl onto mixing bowl lid and weigh chicken into it. Set bowl aside. Place simmering basket onto mixing bowl lid and weigh rice into it. Rinse rice until water runs clear. Place water and 1 teaspoon of the salt into mixing bowl and insert simmmering basket with rice.

Place Varoma dish into position and add carrots into it. Insert Varoma tray and weigh peas onto it, secure Varoma lid and cook <b>13 min/Varoma/speed 4<b>. Transfer rice and vegetables into a thermal serving bowl or other large bowl and cover to keep warm. Rinse mixing bowl.

Place an egg into a separate large bowl and lightly beat. Add cornflour, paprika, pepper, remaining 1 teaspoon salt and chicken and stir to coat. Place chicken in a single layer onto prepared baking tray and bake for 10-12 minutes (200°C), turning once during cooking, until chicken is cooked and crispy.
Place garlic into mixing bowl and chop <b>3 sec/speed 7<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add vinegar, honey, sweet chilli sauce, tomato sauce, sugar, soy sauce and sesame seeds and cook <b>6 min/120°C/speed 2<b>, placing simmering basket instead of measuring cup onto mixing bowl lid, until sauce has slightly thickened.
Toss chicken in sauce. Divide rice and vegetables between serving bowls and top with chicken. Garnish with spring onions/shallots to serve.

hintsAndTricks: To make this recipe gluten free, replace the cornflour and soy sauce with gluten free versions.
To make your own tomato sauce, please refer to the recipe in The Basic Cookbook.
To save time, you can prepare and cook your chicken while the rice is cooking.
